title: Exclusive Halloween 4K Steelbooks And Box Sets On Sale For Lowest Prices Yet

The retailer's new 4K Steelbook Editions of the first three Halloween movies are on sale for their best prices yet. The discounts aren't massive, but Amazon-exclusive editions aren't discounted very often. Halloween (1978) Steelbook Edition is on sale for $39.49 (was $45), and Halloween II's Steelbook Edition is discounted to $37 (was $45). Both of these editions released in September and were followed in late October by Halloween III: Season of the Witch Steelbook Edition, which is on sale for the first time. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Fatal Frame II: Crimson Butterfly Remake Is Up For Preorder
description: Fatal Frame II: Crimson Butterfly Remake $50 | Releases March 12, 2026 Preorder at Amazon Preorder at Walmart Preorder at Target Preorder at GameStop The cult-favorite survival horror series Fatal Frame returns next year when Fatal Frame II: Crimson Butterfly Remake launches for PlayStation 5, Nintendo Switch 2, Xbox Series X|S, and PC on March 12, 2026. As the name implies, this is a remake of the original PS2 game with upgraded visuals, quality-of-life adjustments, and other tweaks one would expect from this era of remakes. Preorders for the game are now live, and grabbing the game early gets you a few in-game bonuses. Physical edition preorders are available for $50 from Amazon, GameStop, Target, and Walmart. Digital preorders are also available with the same perks, and there's a Digital Deluxe Edition that comes with even more bonuses going for $70--that is, unless you're on PC, in which case you can grab the Fatal Frame II: Crimson Butterfly Remake standard edition for just $42.49 (was $50) or the Deluxe Edition for $59.49 (was $70). Fatal Frame II: Crimson Butterfly Remake Preorder Bonuses Fatal Frame II: Crimson Butterfly Remake preorder bonuses. By preordering any version of Fatal Frame II: Crimson Butterfly Remake, you'll get a handful of in-game cosmetic rewards for your characters. Here's what's included: Crimson Butterfly Mayu skin Crimson Butterfly Mio skin Spirit Charm Cat Ears (Black) Cat Ears (White) These bonuses are only available if you secure your copy before launch. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Dark Horse's New Tomb Raider Comic Omnibuses Are 40% Off At Amazon
description: Tomb Raider Colossal Collection Vol. 1 (888 Pages) $59.14 (was $100) See at Amazon Tomb Raider Colossal Collection Vol. 2 (944 Pages) $59.59 (was $100) See at Amazon If you're looking for a way to pass the time until the newly announced Tomb Raider: Legacy of Atlantis arrives next year, you can revisit more of Lara Croft's classic adventures by picking up the newly reissued comic book series. Amazon has terrific deals on Dark Horse's appropriately titled Tomb Raider Colossal Collections right now. The 888-page Colossal Collection Volume 1 is discounted to $59.14 (was $100), which is the best price we've seen since the hardcover comic omnibus hit stores in July. The 944-page Colossal Collection Volume 2 released November 25, but it's already on sale for only $59.59 (was $100). Together, the two books collect Top Cow Productions' 50-issue series published from 1999-2003 as well as Tomb Raider: Journeys and several one-shots. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Marvel's Spider-Man Magic: The Gathering Booster Box Is Nearly 50% Off At Amazon
description: Marvel's Spider-Man Gift Bundle $64 (was $90) See at Amazon Marvel's Spider-Man Play Booster Box (30 Packs) $114 (was $209.70) See at Amazon Spidey's Spectacular Showdown Scene Box $28 (was $42) See at Amazon Magic: The Gathering's Spider-Man set is discounted to surprisingly low prices at Amazon. Multiple products from the relatively new Universes Beyond crossover have never been this cheap before. It's not easy to pick which deal is the best, but the product with the largest discount is the Marvel's Spider-Man Play Booster Box. Launched in late September for $210, the Spider-Man Booster Box is on sale for only $114. The nearly $100 discount means each of the 30 Booster Packs will cost you an average of $3.80. The Spider-Man Gift Bundle is discounted to only $64 (was $90). Featuring comic book-inspired collector's packaging, the Gift Bundle includes one Collector Booster with 15 cards, nine standard Boosters (14 cards each), an Alternate-Art Foil Promo Card, and numerous accessories, including a Spider-Man themed card storage box. Collector Boosters are going for $39 on their own, so this is an incredible deal. If you don't yet own any Marvel's Spider-Man MTG cards, you may be most interested in the Spidey's Spectacular Showdown Scene Box, which includes six Art-Only Cards for display on an included easel, six playable Traditional Foil Borderless Scene Cards, and three Marvel's Spider-Man Play Boosters. Normally $42, the Spider-Man Scene Box is discounted to only $28. Check out the full Marvel's Spider-Man MTG lineup below. The Spider-Man Play Booster Box is the cheapest of the 2025 Universes Beyond sets, but Amazon also has superb deals on Avatar: The Last Airbender's Booster Box ($125) and the newly restocked Final Fantasy Booster Box ($140). Even the upcoming Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Booster Box is on sale for $160. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Want A Bunch Of Free eShop Games This Holiday Season? Here's How
description: If you want to get your hands on nearly a dozen free Switch games this holiday season, now's your chance. Starting today, No Gravity Games is giving away one Switch title per day through December 19, on which day there will be three free games. However, there is a catch that works out in your favor. To claim a free game on Switch, players need to have claimed the previous day's title and maintained it in their library. You must also have at least one No Gravity title prior to claiming the first freebie, but there's a trick you can use to get that for free, too. Just visit No Gravity Games' official site and sign up for the newsletter, and you'll receive a free game. If you do this first, it will count as a "purchased" game from No Gravity and you're able to then claim the other games for free. If players do miss a day, they can rejoin the giveaway chain by purchasing the previous day's game, which will be available at a greatly reduced price. Each title becomes available for free at midnight PT and they will be available to claim on Nintendo's eShop until 11:59pm PT on the same day. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Fortnite's Harry Potter Collab Revealed, Lets You Dress Up Like A Wizard
description: Epic Games has announced the latest major collab in Fortnite, and it's Harry Potter. Warner Bros. Interactive Entertainment and Epic are bringing "the world of Harry Potter" to Epic's platform this month, including Fortnite and Rocket League. The Fortnite Shop will be updated later this month with outfits and accessories based on all things Harry Potter and the wider wizarding world. The outfits can be tailored to specific houses, including Gryffindor, Slytherin, Ravenclaw, and Hufflepuff. Dress up like Harry Potter in Fortnite this month.In Rocket League, the game's Frosty Fest event will include a new Hogwarts House Rivalry event, during which players can earn points for their specific Hogwarts house. There will be Harry Potter-themed in-game shop items, too, and Epic said it will reveal them later this month. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Activision Calls Season 1 CoD: Warzone's "Cleanest In History" For Anti-Cheat Efforts
description: Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 has integrated with Warzone for Season 1, bringing a new Resurgence map, perk changes, and now less hackers to the battle royale. A new post from Activision cites Black Ops 7 Season 1 as being the "cleanest" Warzone launch in history. The publisher says Call of Duty Season 1 launched with the strongest anti-cheat performance Warzone has ever had, and the majority of players are completing their matches without encountering any cheaters. 🛡️ Call of Duty: #BlackOps7 | Call of Duty: #Warzone A message from #TeamRICOCHET:Season 01 launched with the strongest anti-cheat performance Warzone has ever had. The vast majority of players are completing their matches without encountering a single cheater. This our… — Call of Duty Updates (@CODUpdates) December 12, 2025 "This our cleanest Warzone launch in Call of Duty history," Activision says. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: The Last of Us' Bruce Straley Shares More Details About Why He Left Naughty Dog
description: From 1999 to 2017, Bruce Straley was one of the key players at Naughty Dog, and the co-director of two its best-selling games, The Last of Us and Uncharted 4. However, Straley essentially left the game industry for several years despite that impressive track record. Now, Straley is sharing more details regarding his departure, following up on comments he made years ago. "I had been there 18 years. That's a long time for anybody to be anywhere," Straley told Polygon. "I need new problems to solve, I need new creative outlets. I'm not saying there wouldn't be opportunities there, but couple that feeling with the idea that I was working really, really hard at something that wasn’t mine." Straley went on to explain that he didn't jump to another AAA studio because he felt Naughty Dog was the "pinnacle" of developers that made the games he was interested in. And he didn't want to deal with "a whole different bureaucratic or cultural system." Continue Reading at GameSpot

New Tomb Raider Games Recast Lara Croft With A Gaming Veteran
description: The new Tomb Raider games announced at The Game Awards, Tomb Raider: Legacy of Atlantis and Tomb Raider: Catalyst, will feature the voice of Alix Wilton Regan as Lara Croft. This is a change from the latest trilogy--Tomb Raider, Rise of the Tomb Raider, and Shadow of the Tomb Raider--which featured Camilla Luddington voicing and performing the motion-capture for Croft. Wilton Regan is known for her roles as Samantha Traynor in Mass Effect 3 and the female Inquisitor in Dragon Age: Inquisition. She also played Aya in Assassin's Creed Origins. Continue Reading at GameSpot

How Metroid Prime 4: Beyond Fails The Genre Nintendo Created
description: New Metroid games are few and far between, so the launch of Metroid Prime 4: Beyond should have been a monumental event for the fanbase. Instead, eight years after its announcement, and 18 years after the previous game, Nintendo’s big December 2025 release landed with a loud thud. Already, this once highly anticipated title is poised to be one of the series' most divisive games, earning a spot alongside Other M and Federation Force. This isn't for lack of polish, as Prime 4 is indeed visually stunning and perhaps the greatest first-party showcase of graphics on the Nintendo Switch and its successor. But while it has its share of enthusiasts, it’s difficult not to feel underwhelmed by the final product in comparison to prior Prime games and even other, similar entries in the Metroidvania space that has grown in Nintendo’s frequent absence. The list of Metroidvania games from independent and third-party developers in the past decade alone is astonishing, with Ori and the Blind Forest, Axiom Verge, Hollow Knight, Dead Cells, Animal Well, and others throwing new concepts and innovations into the genre’s well of ideas. Hollow Knight and its follow-up, Silksong, have captivated players with their dense worldbuilding, roaming NPCs, and optional side objectives, all of which have come to define the critically acclaimed series. Nine Sols stood out with its intricate combat system, while more out-there games like pinball Metroidvania Yoku’s Island Express have proven anything can be a Metroidvania with the right amount of determination and creativity. Even Prince of Persia: The Lost Crown changed the game with something as simple as an in-game screenshot system to help with backtracking. The Metroidvania genre is rapidly iterating with a volume of unique takes. Continue Reading at GameSpot
